content: Pyrazine dioxide bridged two-dimensional antiferromagnets [M(NCS)2(pzdo)2] (M = Mn, Co; pzdo = pyrazine dioxide)†pyrazine Hao-Ling Sun Bao-Qing Ma Song Gao and Gang Su polymerspyrazine dioxideligandpolymerCyanoazidodicyanamideligandspolymers1pyrazine4,4′-bipyridine2azide3methyl isonicotinate4ligands5ligandpolymers12X-Ray diffraction12ligandsligands4,4′-bipyridine dioxide127 Two-dimensional grid for 2. Selected bond distances (Å) and angles (°): Mn(1)–N(3) 2.114(4), Mn(1)–O(1) 2.208(3), Mn(1)–O(2) 2.226(3). For 2: Co(1)–N(3) 2.045(2), Co(1)–O(1) 2.1116(15), Co(1)–O(2) 2.1315(16). ‡ Syntheses: Mn(NCS)2(pzdo)21: this was carried out by mixing an aqueous solution of MnCl2·4H2O (0.5 mmol, 12.5 ml) with a aqueous solution of NaNCS (2.5 mmol, 12.5 ml). After stirring for 1 h at ca. 80 °C an aqueous solution of pzdo (0.50 mmol, 10 ml) was added. The resulting solution was allowed to stand at room temperature after stirring for 0.5 h. After two weeks, a prismatic, purple, X-ray quality single crystal was obtained (yield 60%) (Calc.: C, 30.08; H, 2.02, N, 21.05. Found: C, 30.12; H, 2.16; N, 20.09%).Co(NCS)2(pzdo)22: this was obtained by mixing an aqueous solution of Co(NCS)2 (0.25 mmol, 2.85 ml), with an aqueous solution of pzdo (0.50 mmol, 10 ml). The resulting solution was allowed to stand at room temperature after stirring for 0.5 h. After several days red prismatic crystals appeared (yield, 70%) (Calc.: C, 30.39; H, 2.04; N, 21.26. Found: C, 30.47; H, 2.117; N, 20.45%).

 Two-dimensional grid for 2. Selected bond distances (Å) and angles (°): Mn(1)-N(3) 2.114(4), Mn(1)-O(1) 2.208(3), Mn(1)-O(2) 2.226(3). For 2: Co(1)-N(3) 2.045(2), Co(1)-O(1) 2.1116(15), Co(1)-O(2) 2.1315(16). 

‡ Syntheses:  Mn(NCS)2(pzdo)21: this was carried out by mixing an aqueous solution of MnCl2⋅4H2O (0.5 mmol, 12.5 ml) with a aqueous solution of NaNCS (2.5 mmol, 12.5 ml). After stirring for 1 h at ca. 80 °C an aqueous solution of pzdo (0.50 mmol, 10 ml) was added. The resulting solution was allowed to stand at room temperature after stirring for 0.5 h. After two weeks, a prismatic, purple, X-ray quality single crystal was obtained (yield 60%) (Calc.: C, 30.08; H, 2.02, N, 21.05. Found: C, 30.12; H, 2.16; N, 20.09%).Co(NCS)2(pzdo)22: this was obtained by mixing an aqueous solution of Co(NCS)2 (0.25 mmol, 2.85 ml), with an aqueous solution of pzdo (0.50 mmol, 10 ml). The resulting solution was allowed to stand at room temperature after stirring for 0.5 h. After several days red prismatic crystals appeared (yield, 70%) (Calc.: C, 30.39; H, 2.04; N, 21.26. Found: C, 30.47; H, 2.117; N, 20.45%).
